name: Kepler-259
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-259 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-259 is a star with 0.795 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.9 times its radius. It is located 3364.56 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-259 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-259 b

Kepler-259 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.12 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-259.

The mass of Kepler-259 b is 11.41 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-259 b is 2.8 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-259 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-259 c

Kepler-259 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 36.92 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-259.

The mass of Kepler-259 c is 10.45 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-259 c is 2.7 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-259 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-259, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
